alert.note: Alert for Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 9:19PM CDT until May 28 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River At Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. Minnesota River at Savage affecting Dakota, Carver, Scott and Hennepin Counties. .River levels are slowly falling back, with chances for showers and thunderstorms over the next few days likely causing localized impacts. Unless there is a direct storm over the parts of the rivers already in flood stage, the gradual decrease in levels should continue. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Savage. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 702.0 feet, Barge loading stops at Port Cargill, and other flood prevention measures are begun. Water begins to impact Black Dog Road in Burnsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 702.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 PM CDT Friday was 702.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 696.1 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 702.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 702.1 feet on 04/09/1967. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
